alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 8:20AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Utah, including the following county, Salt Lake. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 819 AM MDT, Department of Transportation officials reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Sandy, Murray, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Draper, Riverton, Cottonwood Heights, Midvale, Holladay, South Salt Lake, Herriman, Bluffdale, Little Cottonwood Creek Valley, Cottonwood West, Granite, Millcreek and East Millcreek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
